title: Hyundai Exter gets more affordable sunroof-equipped variants
description: The Hyundai Exter has been updated with two new trims that bring down a few features from higher trims, and get additional optional equipment, as well. Called the S Smart and SX Smart, these new trims are priced from Rs 7.69 lakh and Rs 8.16 lakh, respectively, and are available with both petrol and CNG powertrains. Exter S Smart is most affordable trim with sunroof Exter SX Smart gets push button start/stop feature Larger 9.0-inch touchscreen available as optional extra Here’s a detailed price breakdown of the new Hyundai Exter trims: Hyundai Exter S Smart and SX Smart pricesVariant Price (ex-showroom)S Smart Rs 7.69 lakh S Smart AMTRs 8.39 lakh S Smart CNGRs 8.63 lakh SX Smart Rs 8.16 lakh SX Smart AMTRs 8.83 lakh SX Smart CNGRs 9.18 lakh Hyundai Exter gets S Smart and SX Smart trims Exter S Smart: what’s new? Based on the existing S trim, the new S Smart comes equipped with a single-pane sunroof which was previously available from S+ (priced from Rs 7.93 lakh). Other notable features on this trim include LED daytime running lamps, LED tail lamps, TPMS, 15-inch steel wheels, and rear AC vents. Exter SX Smart: what’s new? The addition on the SX Smart trim, which is based on the SX, is keyless entry with push button start/stop feature. It also comes equipped with projector headlamps, rear parking camera, leatherret seat upholstery and a shark fin antenna. New optional equipment On both these trims, customes can also opt for a larger 9.0-inch touchscreen with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, along with a rear camera for Rs 14,999. These are genuine Hyundai accessories, on which the company is also providing a 3-year warranty. As standard, all variants of the Exter only get an 8.0-inch. Hyundai is also made ISOFIX anchor points standard on the Exter. Hyundai Exter powertrain options The Exter is powered by an 83hp, 114Nm 1.2-litre, four-cylinder petrol engine that’s offered with both the 5-speed manual and the 5-speed AMT gearboxes. In CNG spec, this engine produces 69hp and 95.2Nm of torque, and is only offered with a 5-speed manual gearbox. It also gets Hyundai’s new dual CNG cylinder tank setup. All prices ex-showroom, India Also See: MG Windsor EV Pro price starts at Rs 17.49 lakh Honda Elevate Apex Summer Edition launched at Rs 12.39 lakh

html:
Buyers can also opt for a larger 9.0-inch touchscreen on new S Smart and SX Smart trims.

The Hyundai Exter has been updated with two new trims that bring down a few features from higher trims, and get additional optional equipment, as well. Called the S Smart and SX Smart, these new trims are priced from Rs 7.69 lakh and Rs 8.16 lakh, respectively, and are available with both petrol and CNG powertrains.

  1. Exter S Smart is most affordable trim with sunroof
  2. Exter SX Smart gets push button start/stop feature
  3. Larger 9.0-inch touchscreen available as optional extra

Here’s a detailed price breakdown of the new Hyundai Exter trims:

Hyundai Exter S Smart and SX Smart prices
VariantPrice (ex-showroom)
S SmartRs 7.69 lakh
S Smart AMTRs 8.39 lakh
S Smart CNGRs 8.63 lakh
SX SmartRs 8.16 lakh
SX Smart AMTRs 8.83 lakh
SX Smart CNGRs 9.18 lakh

Hyundai Exter gets S Smart and SX Smart trims

Exter S Smart: what’s new?

Based on the existing S trim, the new S Smart comes equipped with a single-pane sunroof which was previously available from S+ (priced from Rs 7.93 lakh). Other notable features on this trim include LED daytime running lamps, LED tail lamps, TPMS, 15-inch steel wheels, and rear AC vents.

Exter SX Smart: what’s new?

The addition on the SX Smart trim, which is based on the SX, is keyless entry with push button start/stop feature. It also comes equipped with projector headlamps, rear parking camera, leatherret seat upholstery and a shark fin antenna.

New optional equipment

On both these trims, customes can also opt for a larger 9.0-inch touchscreen with wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto, along with a rear camera for Rs 14,999. These are genuine Hyundai accessories, on which the company is also providing a 3-year warranty. As standard, all variants of the Exter only get an 8.0-inch. Hyundai is also made ISOFIX anchor points standard on the Exter.

Hyundai Exter powertrain options

The Exter is powered by an 83hp, 114Nm 1.2-litre, four-cylinder petrol engine that’s offered with both the 5-speed manual and the 5-speed AMT gearboxes. In CNG spec, this engine produces 69hp and 95.2Nm of torque, and is only offered with a 5-speed manual gearbox. It also gets Hyundai’s new dual CNG cylinder tank setup.

All prices ex-showroom, India
